hbl.jag.tri.lib

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • hbl.jag.tri.lib.Polygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This public class represents a closed polygon as a list of MicroClass objects (first value repeated as the last value in the ArrayList)given in ccw order. It will also carry an area field that will calculate the enclosed area of the polygon in km^2 and an aux field typically to used to define the value associated with the contour.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addPoint

        public int addPoint(MicroPoint pt)
        Method to add point to polygon
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the size of the polygon list after addition

      • closePoly

        public int closePoly(double diffArea)
        Method to close the polygon by adding the first point as a redundant last point, closing the topological unit. It then calculates the enclosed area of the polygon and stores the answer in the class variable. This method should only be called once for each polygon.
        Parameters:
        double - differential area for area calculation
        Returns:
        the size of the polygon list after closure

      • calculateArea

        public double calculateArea(double diffArea)
        This method calculates the area enclosed by the polygon
        Parameters:
        double - differential area for area calculation
        Returns:
        area of polygon is km^2

        Parameters:

        public boolean inSideOutside(MicroPoint ptTst,
                    MicroPoint ptOut)
        Method to check if a test point is inside or outside of a Polygon object using a line cross count and exact integer math
        Parameters:
        ptTst - the MicroPoint object to test
        ptOut - a MicroPoint object known to be outside the polygon
        Returns:
        true if point is inside, false is outside

        public static void exportContourBNA(java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> polys,
                    CoordTransform coordTrans,
                    java.lang.String fileOut)
        static utility to export the ArrayList polygons as a standard BNA file that can be read by most gis systems
        Parameters:
        polys - ArrayList list to polygon objects to write out
        coordTrans - CoordTransformatin class used to convert cartesian micro-degree data to standard Long/Lat
        fileOut - path name to out put .bna file to be written

      • exportMapAndContourPNG

        public static void exportMapAndContourPNG(java.lang.String bnaMapFile,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> polys,
                          java.lang.String pngFileOut)
        static utility to export a 4000X3200 px JPEG image file of the bounding bna map and the contoured Eulerian density lines that can be imported to any photo handing application where it can be zoomed and then have drag-and-drop "scales" "time and title meta data" and "logo" added for camera ready briefing material ready to print.
        Parameters:
        bnaMapFile - a bna file to input for the map boundary
        polys - ArrayList list of polygons to be drawn
        jpgFileOut - path name of the resulting .jpg file

      • exportContoursGeoJSON

        public static void exportContoursGeoJSON(java.util.ArrayList<Polygon> polys,
                         CoordTransform coordTrans,
                         java.lang.String fileOut)
        static utility to export an ArrayList polygons into a public domain geoJSON text file of type "FeatureCollection" where the "Features" are type Polygon with properties are "level" double(%/km^2) and "area" double(km^2)
        Parameters:
        polys - ArrayList list of polygons
        coordTrans - CoordTransform object defining the Mercator projection - member of DagData structure
        fileOut - path name of output file of .geoJson

      • thinBNAmap

        public static void thinBNAmap(java.lang.String mapIn,
              java.lang.String newTarget,
              double delta0,
              double eps0)
        This is a static method that will take as input a BNA map (typically one generated for use in Gnome and exported from it during trajectory runs. (Before doing anything the method will check whether "thinned map" already exists in a specified target file and if that file exists no action will be taken.) The thinning algorithm will be based on a two parameter method that will insure that points are no farther apart then "delta" and that replacement boundaries are never moved laterally more then "eps"
        Parameters:
        mapIN - String path name to input BNA map
        newTarget - String path name to thinned target BNA map
        delta - maximum distance between boundary points
        eps - maximum lateral movement of boundary points

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
